EM540.name: Emergency Medicine for Preclinical Students
EM540.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM540.description: A precepting experience in the principles of emergency care in the hospital.
EM540.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Human Medicine or in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

EM630.name: Emergency Medicine Clerkship
EM630.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM630.description: Clinical diagnosis and treatment of the undifferentiated patient in the emergency department setting.
EM630.prerequisite: {(FM 608 or MED 608 or PHD 600 or SUR 608) and (FM 608 or MED 608 or PHD 600 or SUR 608)} or HM 556
EM630.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

EM631.name: Clinical Experience in Emergency Medicine
EM631.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM631.description: Clinical diagnosis of the undifferentiated patient in the emergency department setting.
EM631.prerequisite: (HM 556) or (FM 608 and MED 608 and PHD 600 and PSC 608 and OGR 608 and SUR 608)
EM631.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

EM632.name: Senior Clinical Elective in Emergency Medicine
EM632.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM632.description: Four-week elective in clinical diagnosis and treatment of the undifferentiated patient in the emergency department setting. Intended for students planning to apply to an Emergency Medicine Residency.
EM632.prerequisite: {(FM 641 or MED 641 or PHD 641 or PSC 641 or OGR 641 or SUR 641) and (FM 641 or MED 641 or PHD 641 or PSC 641 or OGR 641 or SUR 641) and (FM 641 or MED 641 or PHD 641 or PSC 641 or OGR 641 or SUR 641) and (FM 641 or MED 641 or PHD 641 or PSC 641 or OGR 641 or SUR 641)} or (FM 608 and MED 608 and PHD 600 and PSC 608 and OGR 608 and SUR 608)
EM632.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

EM633.name: Emergency Medicine Sub-Specialty Clinical Elective
EM633.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM633.description: Care of patients with emergent conditions in one or more EM sub-specialty domains
EM633.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.

EM634.name: Special Topics in Emergency Medicine (Interim New)
EM634.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
EM634.description: Knowledge and skills to manage acute medical emergencies in adult and pediatric patients.
EM634.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Human Medicine.
